body: Thanks. Ping me to merge once comment is addressed and tests are green.

- agree, I will simplify with a "regular" DoFn

Couple of comments:
1. as MQTT is based on a pub/sub pattern (using a topic, it's not a queue), IMHO, the `testRead()` test is correct as a publisher has to send a message to the pipeline (subscriber) in the same time.
2. in the `initialSplit`, we should use different `clientId` to be compliant with the spec. However, generally speaking, as the `MqttIO` `Source` is a subscriber to the MQTT topic, creating several sources means that we will receive the same message multiple time. So, I think we should create an unique source. In that case, I wonder if it doesn't make more sense to use a simple `DoFn`Â for the `Read` instead of a `Source`. @jkff what do you think ?

OK, I found the issue: by default mongod (embedded instance) is bound to 27017 (default MongoDB port number). That's why it works even with the range. Actually, just changing the range to exclude 27017 fails. I'm fixing that.
LGTM
Thank you.

Confirmed that the expected integration tests and unit tests ran. LGTM and nice to have a green, clean, merge.
Yes, agree. I'm building the branch locally anyway.

I found the issue: it's actually in the IO itself. The `MongoClient` creation in the `estimatedSize` and `splitIntoBundles` doesn't use the provided `URI`, that's why it tries on port 27017 by default. I'm fixing ;)
Rebased and fixed.
Thanks, I do it now. I keep you posted.

By the way, not directly related, but it would be great to avoid deprecated code when possible:
- `MongoClient` instead of `Mongo` (deprecated)
- `MongoClientURI` instead of `MongoURI`
- `getDatabase()` instead of `getDB()`

It's used in the `MongoDbIO`, so `MongoDbGridFSIO` could use it as well.
LGTM. No comments of any kind.
The changes on the Flink side look good ð

@staslev and I discussed this and this needs more thinking as the proposed solution here might still be affected by races in case of reusing context repeatedly (for example tests).
Let's discuss in JIRA and PR for review once we have a better solution.
Can you please rebase (I did a change on the test) ? Else I can do it for you.

Even with the rebase:
1. `thread.join()` is blocked
2. removing the publisher thread block the test as the test pipeline is blocked on the `queue.poll()` (which is normal IMHO as we are in a publish/subscribe pattern).

It seems that neither Spark or Flink runners were actually built by Jenkins as Direct runner failed on "unused imports" in checkstyle.

I've added some comments for the changes in the Spark runner, and I've also built the PR branch locally (ignoring checkstyle) and executed the integrations tests for `local-runnable-on-service-tests` for both Spark and Flink (to avoid surprises in post-commit) and I'm happy to say they both passed.
@dhalperi Thanks! Just out of curiosity, will this make it into a 0.3 patch release or will it wait until 0.4.0?

@aviemzur there's a checkstyle issue: https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_MavenVerify/4908/org.apache.beam$beam-runners-spark/console
@peihe I'd like to hear your thoughts before merging so I'll wait a couple of days.
LGTM.
R: @tgroh

Working on the rebase... changes to the direct runner apparently are changing how the bundles are created so the new test is failing.  I'll work on that tomorrow.

Regarding the deprecated classes:  there is nothing that can done right now.   The GridFS API's require the use of the older classes.   The new 3.3 version of the mongo drivers has new GridFS API's that can use the new classes, but I haven't seen anyone yet willing to use the 3.3 drivers in production.   To support 3.2 and older, we have to use the deprecated objects.

Thanks, no problem for deprecated classes.

I will take a look on the failing test as well.
Where does this PR stand? Can we move forward?
